ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] robots.txt problem

I have been running a 5 instance crawl since December 23rd.  I noticed 
today, that the hourly checkpoints stopped occurring for instance 0, on 
cp00102

crawl.log.cp00102-20111227121847
frontier.recover.gz.cp00102-20111227121847
nonfatal-errors.log.cp00102-20111227121847
progress-statistics.log.cp00102-20111227121847
runtime-errors.log.cp00102-20111227121847
uri-errors.log.cp00102-20111227121847


Attempting to manually create a checkpoint produced the error below.

The crawler appears to be capturing URIs even though the checkpoints are 
not happening.

I have also included excerpts from heritrix_out.log

It appears that from the log that cp00103-20111227131848 directory could 
not be created, but that directory (which is empty) was created.

Is there anyway that I can get around this problem so that I don't loose 
all of the crawling data between when it stopped creating checkpoints 
and now?


--David


An error occured
You may be able to recover and try something else by going back.
Cause: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Checkpoint already running.
